title: Things Fall Apart
author: Chinua Achebe
descriptions: A powerful novel exploring the clash between tradition and modernity in pre-colonial Nigeria, following Okonkwo's struggle with the arrival of British colonialism.

title: Fairy Tales
author: Hans Christian Andersen
descriptions: A timeless collection of enchanting stories, including 'The Little Mermaid' and 'The Ugly Duckling.'

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
descriptions: An epic poem about a journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, exploring themes of sin, redemption, and divine love.

title: The Epic of Gilgamesh
author: Unknown
descriptions: One of the oldest surviving works of literature, this epic poem tells the story of Gilgamesh, a Mesopotamian king known for his strength and arrogance.

title: The Book of Job
author: Unknown
descriptions: A thought-provoking story exploring the themes of faith and suffering, as Job, a righteous man, faces devastating hardships.

title: One Thousand and One Nights
author: Unknown
descriptions: A collection of enchanting stories featuring jinn, magic, and adventure, told by Scheherazade to save her own life.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
descriptions: A classic novel exploring themes of social class, love, and deception, following Elizabeth Bennet's journey through 19th-century England.

title: Le Père Goriot
author: Honoré de Balzac
descriptions: A captivating novel exploring the dark side of Parisian society, centering around Père Goriot's selflessness and the greed of those around him.

title: Molloy, Malone Dies, The Unnamable
author: Samuel Beckett
descriptions: A trilogy exploring themes of alienation, existence, and the human condition in an absurdist light, challenging readers with profound questions about life's meaning.

title: The Decameron
author: Giovanni Boccaccio
descriptions: A collection of bawdy and entertaining tales set against the backdrop of the Black Death, offering a satirical commentary on medieval society.
